required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Calypso Knee System Clinical Sub-study, OUS Continued Evaluation
clinical_study.official_title: Continued Evaluation of the Calypso Knee System for Symptom Relief in Subjects With Medial Knee Osteoarthritis, OUS

brief_summary.textblock: Calypso Knee System Clinical Study, OUS for subjects with symptomatic osteoarthritis of the medial compartment of the knee. The sub-study will achieve continued evaluation of the safety and clinical effectiveness of the Calypso Knee System.

detailed_description.textblock: This sub-study will be a single-arm, prospective, multi-center sub-study for continued evaluation of the safety and clinical effectiveness of Calypso Knee System using an additional measure of post-operative activity improvement.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Study closed based on continued restrictions around COVID-19

primary_outcome.measure: The primary endpoint of this pilot study is the rate of individual subject success at 24 months. A subject will be declared a clinical success if all of the following conditions are met
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change at 24 months relative to baseline
primary_outcome.description: Clinically Significant improvement in Western Ontario and McMasters University Osteoarthritis Index (WOMAC) Pain Clinically Significant improvement in Western Ontario and McMasters University Osteoarthritis Index (WOMAC) Function Freedom from applicable device-related SAEs requiring surgical intervention Maintenance of Implant Integrity by Radiographic Review

intervention.description: The Calypso Knee System is an extra-capsular knee implant designed to fill the therapeutic gap between conservative care and more invasive surgical interventions for knee osteoarthritis.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Participants age - 25 to 65 years
2. Body Mass Index (BMI) of < 35, Weight < 300 lbs
3. Knee osteoarthritis pain on the inner side of knee that has continued after at least 6 months of non-operative treatment
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Symptoms of osteoarthritis in the other knee or in lateral (outer) or patellofemoral compartments of the target knee
2. Knee ligament or meniscal instability
3. Other bone or joint conditions such as Rheumatoid arthritis, Paget's disease, Charcot's disease or general conditions such as allergy or hypersensitivity to certain metals, active infection, certain neurological conditions, use of medication such as steroids or chemotherapy that could impact study participation or results
